LockView.Sett.ScreenWidth_Hint: The real world screen width in mm or inch. Must be set on the local (TV's) client
LockView.Sett.Gridsize_Hint: The real world grid size in mm or inch (e.g. 25 mm or 1 inch). Unit has to be the same as 'Screen Width'. Must be set on the local (TV's) client
LockView.Sett.LockOverride_Hint: Enter a keybinding to allow users to override the zoom and pan lock
LockView.Sett.HideControlBtn_Hint: Hides the control button on the left side of the screen
LockView.Sett.SceneConfigurator.Title: Scene Configurator
LockView.Sett.SceneConfigurator.Hint: Open the Scene Configurator to easily configure Lock View settings for all scenes.
LockView.Sett.SceneConfigurator.Copy.Not: Copy the scene configuration of this scene
LockView.Sett.SceneConfigurator.Paste.No: Paste the copied scene configuration onto this scene
LockView.Sett.SceneConfigurator.Reset.No: Reset the scene configuration to the default configuration
LockView.Sett.SceneConfigurator.Explanat: Configure the Lock View settings for all scenes. Each row (except the 'Default' row) shows the Lock View settings of the specified scene.
The 3 buttons on the right do the following:
The 'Default' row shows the default configuration. Whenever a new scene is created, or a scene has not been configured for Lock View yet, the default configuration will be applied.
LockView.EnMenu.Description: Select which users the module can control and for what users the viewbox should be enabled.
LockView.EnMenu.UserSettings_Note: Configure each user individually. The 'Default' settings are applied to new and unconfigured users
LockView.EnMenu.Overrides_Note: Override the settings for all users of a specific user role
LockView.EnMenu.Name: Name
LockView.EnMenu.Control_Hint: Allows the user to control enabled users (always enabled for the GM). This will give access to the control buttons (to enable/disable locks, view/edit viewboxes, etc)
LockView.EnMenu.Enable_Hint: Enables all features for the user (locks, autoscaling, etc), except for the viewbox
LockView.EnMenu.Viewbox_Hint: Enables the viewbox for the user, and allows the view to be controlled
LockView.Scene.Autoscale.Label: Autoscale
LockView.Scene.Autoscale_Hint: Automatically calculates a scaling factor to either fit the scene to the screen, or so the grid is always the same physical size on the screen. This is overridden by the Bounding Box setting
LockView.Scene.Rotation.Label: Rotation
LockView.Scene.Rotation_Hint: Automatically rotate the canvas upon loading the screen. Useful for fitting a portrait scene on a landscape screen (or vice versa)
LockView.Scene.ForceInit_Hint: Forces the view to the 'Initial View Position' after loading the scene. Note: only works if 'Autoscale' is set to 'Off' or 'Physical Gridsize'. Pressing the 'Set Initial View' button opens a configuration with more options to set the initial view.
LockView.Scene.boundingBox_Hint: Limit zoom and pan to stay within a bounding box. By default this is the whole canvas, but this can be defined by drawing a rectangle and editing the drawing configuration. This overrides autoscaling
LockView.Scene.excludeSidebar_Hint: Excludes the area behind the sidebar from the bounding box or autoscaling
LockView.Scene.blackenSidebar_Hint:
Blackens the background of the sidebar to prevent users from seeing outside of the bounding box or canvas
(only works if 'Exclude Sidebar' is enabled
LockView.Scene.HideUI: Hide UI Elements on Sidebar Collapse
LockView.Scene.HideUI_Hint: Hides selected UI elements when the sidebar is collapsed
LockView.Scene.Sidebar_Hint: Configure what the sidebar should do when the scene is loaded
LockView.Scene.Hint: Configure the Lock View settings for this scene.
LockView.SetView.Title: Set View
LockView.boundingBox.Note:
You can force player pan and zoom to stay within a bounding box.
This needs to first be enabled in the 'Scene Configuration' or using the control buttons.

Disabled: the bounding box is equal to the scene
Owned Tokens: Only force to this box if the player owns a token within the box.
Always: Always force players to stay within this box.
LockView.boundingBox.Label: Force to bounding box
LockView.UI.NoConnect: No connected and enabled clients on this scene
LockView.UI.NotOnScene: You cannot set the initial view position for a scene that you are not viewing
LockView.SetInitialView.Title: Configure Initial View Position
